commit.message:
Address a review comment by a adding a comment about ImpalaHttpClient having
originated in Imapla Shell.
Add the message body into the HttpError so that it can be observed.
This isn't always present but it can be useful.

Add HTTP code handling to THttpClient (#380)

Before this change Impyla is not checking HTTP return codes when
using the hs2-http protocol. Impyla is sending a request message
(e.g. send_CloseOperation) but the HTTP call to send this message may
fail. This will result in a failure when reading the reply (e.g. in
recv_CloseOperation) as there is no reply data to read. This will
typically result in an 'EOFError'.

Replace use of HTTPClient with ImpalaHttpClient. This code is copied
from Impala Shell. Make some small changes to enable this code to run on
Python3 as well as Python2. Http errors result in the throwing of a new
exception 'HttpError' (a subclass of RpcError) so that the http code can
be accessed directly.

This change does not contain any attempt to recover from an HTTP
failures but it does allow the failure to be detected. In future it may
be possible to retry after certain HTTP errors.

Testing:
- Add a new test that tries to connect to an HTTP
  server that always returns a 503 error. Check that an HttpError
  exception is thrown that contains the Http error code and message.

Disable failing tests - #401 (#402)

Just skip these test for now instead of fixing them.

Also remove the skips for some hive tests that blamed
HIVE-11723 - that is long fixed.

Also adds IMPYLA_SKIP_HIVE_TESTS env var to skip
the other failing test that depends on hive.

verification.payload:
tree 31ea17ea90efb4c8e2d86d7b23b216a1e7c17f6a
parent 9f7ced4ce19df6af8a91c519ee668174d9ece76b
author Tim Armstrong <tim.g.armstrong@gmail.com> 1590084781 -0700
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1590084781 -0700

commit.message:
Fix interoperability with Hive client version >= V10 (#396) (#397)

Impyla uses Hive client version V6 and doesn't work correctly
against Hive client protocol version >= V10.

The issue happens when async compilation is enabled:
1. Impyla waits for the query to get into a fetchable state.
2. Impyla checks TOperationHandle.hasResultSet before trying to
fetch the results.

The problem is that TOperationHandle.hasResultSet is not set
correctly any longer. The flag was moved to
TGetOperationStatusResp in later Hive client versions.

This fix makes sure that TGetOperationStatusResp.hasResultSet is
used instead of TOperationHandle.hasResultSet if present.

Testing:
- Manually tested against a Hive client version V10.

Co-authored-by: Attila Jeges <attilaj@cloudera.com>

verification.payload:
tree fe554eef8bbc8563446c6b06fb7654ba832fab9b
parent ed0f8bcbca14bbabe4590716bfea58b59536566c
author Jeges Attila <attila.jeges@gmail.com> 1588367312 +0200
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1588367312 -0700

Fix interoperability with Hive client version >= V10 (#396) (#397)

Impyla uses Hive client version V6 and doesn't work correctly
against Hive client protocol version >= V10.

The issue happens when async compilation is enabled:
1. Impyla waits for the query to get into a fetchable state.
2. Impyla checks TOperationHandle.hasResultSet before trying to
fetch the results.

The problem is that TOperationHandle.hasResultSet is not set
correctly any longer. The flag was moved to
TGetOperationStatusResp in later Hive client versions.

This fix makes sure that TGetOperationStatusResp.hasResultSet is
used instead of TOperationHandle.hasResultSet if present.

Testing:
- Manually tested against a Hive client version V10.

Co-authored-by: Attila Jeges <attilaj@cloudera.com>

commit.message:
Make connecting over HTTP compatible with python 3. (#378)

- Under python 3, base64.encodestring() requires a byte sequence.

- For python 3, import THttpClient from thriftpy2.http

- Impyla uses thrift for python 2 and thriftpy2 for python 3.
  These libraries provide slightly different API's for opening the
  transport. For thrift, the method is called isOpen() regardless
  of the transport type. For thriftpy2, THttpClient retains isOpen(),
  but otherwise uses is_open().

Tested by connecting to unsecure, kerberized, and HTTP impalad's
using both python 2 and python 3.

commit.message: fix ImportError  'THttpClient' in python3+ (#363)

Update hiveserver2.py with new property @rowcounts (#346)

This change adds a new property (@rowcounts) to return modified/impacted rows and error rows (when working with Kudu tables)

Add HTTP endpoint support (#359)

This change adds HTTP endpoint support to Impyla. I tested this locally against Impala on my development box. I also added some tests to Impala in a preview change [1] and once we release a new Thrift release, these will make sure we don't regress the new functionality in the future.



[1] https://gerrit.cloudera.org/#/c/14059/

This change adds HTTP endpoint support to Impyla. I tested this locally against Impala on my development box. I also added some tests to Impala in a preview change [1] and once we release a new Thrift release, these will make sure we don't regress the new functionality in the future.

commit.message: bugfix: function executemany() cannot pass parameter configuration to inner execute(). (#361)
Remove non exist args from docstring (#355)

include thrift_sasl in setup.py (#273)

* include thrift_sasl in setup.py for Python3

I've also pinned the version pending the resolution of #268

* Add thrift_sasl as optional dependency
Make thriftpy2 range locked, not specific version locked.  Allows for happybase and impyla to co-exist in a 3.7 environment.. (#353)

Fixed numeric parameter substitution bug  - Fixes #317 and #349 (#348)

* Fixed numeric parameter substitution bug:
1) For direct use of number paramstyle by making the substitution operation from a loop to a one shot.
2) For qmark or format paramstyle: After the substition already happened successfully but got processed again at the numeric paramstyle step. Fixed by allowing the user to explicitly define the paramstyle he is using.
Solution 2 could be improved by sniffing the paramstyle or sticking with the default instead of trying to solve everything and allowing a mix of several styles.

* Add some tests for parameter substitution

Add a changelog of recent commits before cutting the next release. (#344)

It doesn't appear that impyla has ever included a change log in the manifest.
Since there have been so many changes since the last release (0.14.2.2) and
the proposed release of 0.15a1, it seems like a good time to amend that

Tested by setting up two different virtualenvs, and confirming that
the expected requirements were installed, and that the connect function
could be imported from impala.dbapi.
